meanings.definition: To write, engrave, or mark again on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She carefully reinscribed her name on the trophy.
meanings.sent2: The artist reinscribed the date on the painting after it faded.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly reinscribed his initials on the sandcastle, claiming it as his own.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day were reinscribed in her mind like etchings on glass.
meanings.sent5: The words were reinscribed on the ancient tablet, preserving history for generations to come.

meanings.definition: To inscribe or write again in a different context or form.
meanings.sent1: The author reinscribed the dedication in the new edition of the book.
meanings.sent2: The message was reinscribed in a more formal tone for the official document.
meanings.sent3: She playfully reinscribed the note on a colorful post-it for a cheerful touch.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was reinscribed in his heart, resonating with every beat.
meanings.sent5: The values of the organization were reinscribed in the updated mission statement, reflecting growth and progress.
